replies.body: Garen has cc...Garen also has his own problems so just cc him

Marksmen aren't supposed to be dealing with people getting on top of them. They are supposed to implode if someone gets near them. Otherwise, whats the point of having different roles if marksmen can both prevent people from getting on them, as well as blowing up anyone who gets near them

So why do Fighters, Assassins and Tanks all have means to burst through whatever my support is doing to get to me? Is it not the point of meaningful weaknesses for enemies to have trouble getting to me if I'm in a good position?

{{item:3147}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3078}} 

Those items (particularly the lethality ones) are a major problem in that they let those aforementioned champions get to me all the more easily and STILL burst me unless they're locked down.

Meaningful weaknesses have been discarded as "anti-fun". Assassins are supposed to wait until shit is blown or I'm out of position. Fighters and Tanks are supposed to push me out of position but not necessarily just get to me. Marksmen are literally the only class that actually pays for their high damage output with being exceptionally vulnerable if they're caught. The rest just plow through or target someone else.
I dont understand cleaver and Triforce. These give 20 move speed. 60 if I manage to kill someone on your team. Have you seen the movespeed your stormrazor gives?

Trinity also has some % movement speed on it with most champions who buy it being naturally faster than marksmen.

For Cleaver? It's more about the health and the fact it's consistent movement once on top of the marksman (which also goes for Trinity but it better supports burst).

Stormrazor gives 0.75 seconds of 20% movement speed. This is arguably once per dive because you're not going to stop attacking for 2 seconds to reset the passive and get the movement bonus again.

So I'll grant you that Stormrazor grants about 3x as much movement as Cleaver does (20% of 325 = 61), but it's a much shorter and less consistent bonus. Cleaver still grants health (for surviving tower) as does Trinity and both help increase the damage the Marksman takes (either by reducing his defense or increasing your output).

I dont know why your treating cleaver as 'big health item'. It gives 150 Hp over Trinity. Do you think that 150 HP does jack shit these days?

Trinity giving 5% extra mv speed does jack shit as so do all of these {{item:3085}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3087}} (with hurricane giving even more), and all Adc's have atleast one of these. 

But if you seriously think a {{item:3071}} or {{item:3078}} is the reason a {{champion:122}} will catch a {{champion:236}} then thats up to you.

One, Darius just hitting Lucian once with Cleaver means he will have no trouble keeping up even after Lucian's dash as his bleed is physical damage. And Lucian turning to proc his passive to get another dash up will just mean Darius pulls and obliterates him from there.

Two, let's assume Darius Flash Q'd Lucian. In almost all cases, Lucian will not have flashed out of that himself and will now be bleeding. Even with Flash and Dash, Darius will have over 5 seconds of movement with Cleaver which will also be shredding Lucian's Armor for the rest of Darius' assault.

Three, almost every single melee champion has a stronger base movement speed than a Marksman.

Lastly, when has any Zeal upgrade other than Static or RFC been the common item on most marksman? RFC and Static share the lowest bonus of 5%, equal to Trinity and yet still less because Trinity also grants some flat movement with basic attacks.

Have you ever played a bruiser? The moment you get on an Adc your either peeled of by a support or the Adc just uses {{item:3153}} to remove half your move speed, you turn around to find other targets only for the same Adc to now be blowing you up.

Moreover, in high elo the Darius will almost never 'just pull Lucian', Lucian has a dash he can use to dodge the pull since the dash is given priority. Unless you have a dash or blink your never catching anyone (again in high elo). You make it sound like I can just walk up and hit Lucian, in what universe.

Lastly, no joke if the Lucian has a {{item:3153}} and Im not on 120 armor + with tabi theres a good chance I will die before completing my combo on Lucian

The only ones with any solid CC are Ashe, Caitlyn, Jhin, Jinx and Varus.

Varus and Ashe have theirs tied to their ultimate. So it's less likely to be up to help them survive. Caitlyn's is tied to her traps, which are easily walked around most of the time and rarely useful for stopping something in progress. Jinx is also tied to a trap but is better for something in progress. Jhin's is best when he can keep his distance, which mobility creep negates, and is also easily dodged.
Tristana can effectively make 2000 units of distance between herself and her target, and Jhin is the fast.

Yes, but for her, Ashe and Varus it's tied to the ultimate, meaning it's not as consistently up. Jhin's movement also only comes after his 4th shot, which he'll be lucky to be on or to just get off of when the gank comes in.

I believe you are disagreeing just for the sake of disagreeing.
As I said, deleting a squishy is what an Assassin should do. Thats absolutely OK. Thats their kit. I don't hate them i just see them as problematic at the current power state. 
This is due to the bias towards going on the ADC. As an ADC you have very little fun atm. You get bullied by supports in lane and when you are just strong enough to survive that harrase mid lane usually starts roaming and deleting you under turret.

And here is the problem. I have no other option but to be there and at this time I can't even get an GA. When i reach level 6 on bot and am about to finish my first item the mid does the same but on lvl 7-8. So assassins in mid get a highe advatage over bot lane. They get on with one item and have a higher level and mobility. 
There is nothing I can do but keep farming, but I can't keep farming because so many high mobility assassins just wait for me to step into the middle of my lane. If the jungler is an assassin this gets even worse, but thank good they are still rarely seen in jungle and if they are junglers they only get on at level 6 so you usual get a bit of time to farm.


So all this is kinda OK I believe assassins are to strong though. And this is where the problem arises. They are in every other game. I get not to have a say in the game I have to play like I am about to die. This is what ADCs usually do, but now it doesn't even matter if I am ahead. And that spoils the fun.

Anaother problem is that for every other role dying is not that horrific. Every other role gets their rotation out and has to wait for CDs anyway so dying ofter the inital burst is ok, for some it even works exceptionally well with ignite. get your rotation out, ignite, die, still get the kill. This leads to games where both mids (most of the time happens with assassins) are 6/6 and just take over the whole game, cause dying is not an issue for them. They don't need to farm after their powerspike. They can one shot you for the rest of the game. These two mid laners now take it out on the rest of the team and snowball it out. The worst part about this is, I lak waveclear as an ADC so both mids show up to have fun on bot and take away the farm with their waveclear tools (if they have any) if they have no waveclear tool they still take huge chuncks of minions while fighting it out or just waiting for something to happen.


It takes the fun away. They are just to strong, need to little gold while to much gold is in the game and also live in a weird economy of "It doesn't matter if I give away gold by dying, I can one shot the 10/1 squishy in the enemie team anyway.

So the problem is not that for an ADC they pose a unfun and hard to beat situation, the problem is they take over the game accelerate it and leave only scorched earth. They are not punished for bad play. Every assassin can come back into a game with just one good fight. Every tried that as an ADC?
